body.p: This topic contains reusable fragments for the installation topics. The reuse strategy is to ensure that key values can be edited and compared in one place. We reuse in big chunks as reusing highly granular pieces just makes things hard to edit without any real maintainability win. In some cases, content that fits in only one topic is still included here and conrefed into the topic to keep all the information, such as requirements, in one file for ease of editing.

section.p: In this section, the reusable element is the dd element of each dlentry. Where the requirement is the same across platform, there is one entry per requirement that is used in all platforms. Where there are different requirements per platform, the id of the reusable dd element is in the form requirement.platform (for instance, memory.windows).

To see the exact Java update version that is supported, go to www.oxygenxml.com, navigate to the Download page for the particular product you are installing, and click on the tab for your particular platform. may work with other versions of Java, but since has only been thoroughly tested with specific versions, there is no guarantee that it will be stable with any other Java version.
uses the following rules to determine which installed version of Java to use:
If you install using the native Windows installer, which installs a version of Java as part of the installation, the version in the jre subdirectory of the installation directory is used.
Otherwise, if the Windows environment variable JAVA_HOME is set, uses the Java version pointed to by this variable.
Otherwise, the version of Java pointed to by your PATH environment variable is used.
If you run using the batch file, oxygen.batoxygenAuthor.batoxygenDeveloper.batoxygenJSON.batsyncroSVNClient.bat, you can edit the batch file to specify a particular version to use.
On Eclipse, uses the same Java Virtual Machine as the copy of Eclipse it is running in.

To install an add-on that is hosted on a remote update site, follow these steps:
Go to Help Install new add-ons .
In the displayed dialog box, enter or paste the update site that hosts the add-on in the Show add-ons from field (or select it from the drop-down menu, if applicable). The default add-ons are hosted on https://www.oxygenxml.com/InstData/Addons/default/updateSite.xml. If you want to see a list of all the default and sample add-ons that are available on the Oxygen remote update sites, choose ALL AVAILABLE SITES from the drop-down menu. The add-ons list contains the name, status, update version, version, and the type of the add-on (either framework, or plugin). A short description of each add-on is presented under the add-ons list.To see all the versions of the add-ons, deselect Show only compatible add-ons and Show only the latest version of the add-ons. Incompatible add-ons are shown only to acknowledge their presence on the remote update site, but you cannot install an incompatible add-on.
Choose the add-ons you want to install, click the Next button, then follow the on-screen instructions.Accepting the license agreement of the add-on is a mandatory step in the installation process.Installing from update sites other than the official Oxygen sites may cause security risks. Please verify that all your installed third-party add-ons come from companies or individuals that you have verified and that you implicitly trust. As a way to help with identifying possible add-on security problems, issues warnings for unsigned plugins.All add-ons are installed in the extensions directory inside the preferences directory. As an alternate approach, you can add an Install button to a web page that links to a URL that has the syntax https://host/path/to/updateSite.xml?oxygenAddonId=addOnIDValue and drop the button into the application's main editing area.
